Question Poster24 May 2019Yes, if you look at the semantics behind these two terms, they are indeed different. However, this is not to say that they are to be considered as mutually exclusive. In fact, the blockchain is a subset of the DLT where cryptocurrencies can find its use case. Essentially, they are synonymous since they are a part of the ecosystem within that blockchain.Question Poster24 May 2019In fact, if one has kept in touch with recent news, Large institutions like Bakkt (owns NYSE) and Fidelity Investments are starting to onboard their institutional investors, allowing them to add Bitcoins in their portfolios.
